title: Since Google is proving useless in my hour of need...
content:
Does anyone know where I could get some good biographical information on Willi Kunz and images of some of his work? I have a report to do for a class, and so far, browsing the web has been hit or miss. I already have a copy of Macro and Microaesthetics from the school library and am currently waiting for the copy of his other book to come in. However this doesnt give me a good sampling of his work and style. So if anyone knows of a good source of info that’d be great. Please and thank you.

-Ashlie  
 [Ashliefleig@gmail.com](mailto:Ashliefleig@gmail.com)

 [‹ Anyone know about silkscreening? And halftoning?](http://web.archive.org/web/20071031225854/http:/typophile.com/node/38164 "Go to previous forum topic") [New Kodak Logo ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071031225854/http:/typophile.com/node/17133 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Ashlie Fleig

comments.content: [Here’s](http://web.archive.org/web/20071031225854/http:/kosmograd.typepad.com/kosmograd/2007/10/36-posters-by-w.html) a showing of most of Kunz’s posters for the Columbia School of Architecture.

Are you aware that you can do [advanced searching](http://web.archive.org/web/20071031225854/http:/www.google.com/advanced_search?hl=en), e.g. for an exact phrase? Put “Willi Kunz” in quotes, and you’ll get a lot of good information. Google may be evil, but it’s not bad. ;°)
Adding a +bio gets you a few bits, but scant, as seen [here.](http://web.archive.org/web/20071031225854/http:/www.artfacts.net/index.php/pageType/artistInfo/artist/118255)
